intro: Macrotropis, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers and hairy, opposite leaves. It thrives in warm, tropical climates and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Macrotropis is also known for its ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and bees.
